title: The Island with Bear Grylls Morag violently ill from dirty water
text:
Morag was violently ill after drinking contaminated water (Picture: Channel 4)

Treasure Island with Bear Grylls almost lost contestant Morag after she drank contaminated water in the final episode.

The island’s water supply was contaminated by seawater after the tide came in unexpectedly.

While part of the group went to hunt down an alternative supply, Morag complained she was incredibly thirsty and had to drink some of the water, despite Manu warning her that it was unsafe.

She claimed that the water didn’t taste ‘that bad’, but she was in for a shock later in the day when she fell violently ill.

The 58-year-old began vomiting constantly and confessed she had ‘s**t myself’, and had to be comforted by fellow contestant Cat.

The others had to call the safety team to find out what to do, and they told them she had to ride it out overnight.

Morag, clearly distressed, demanded to be taken off the island.

She was comforted by Cat (Picture: Channel 4)

Her ordeal continued throughout the night (Picture: Channel 4)

Explaining the situation to camera, Cat said: ‘There’s bile coming out of her, there’s all this green crap, our nearest hospital ain’t near.’

Thankfully the next day she was over the worst of it and was able to rejoin the group.

Mo told the others: ‘You do not want to experience what I’ve just been through. Explosive both ends. Jesus wept.’

When another contestant asked her if she’s ever had a hangover before, she replied: ‘Not where it’s like projectile vomit and s**t at the same time.’

She said away from the group: ‘I borrowed two or three different people’s pants. I’ve s**t on them. Oh my god you don’t wanna know.’

The episode also saw the group finally manage to trap and kill a goat for a meal, and manage to find the final box of cash which was split between all of them.

Bear got in touch and said they had done ‘incredibly well’ and would be leaving the island in 24 hours.

Marco, Jack and Ivor generously gave Cat an extra £1000, while Jack also gave Irene and Mo a share of his money too.

The Island with Bear Grylls airs Sundays at 9pm on Channel 4.
